result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathon A. Brugler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Apprs: CO: SRN for EFV, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. Jonathon A. Brugler pro se. Case called at 3:35. DE updates the Court. DE has completed his community service and his assessment. DE questions expungment. DE will send the information to the probation officer. DE to send a note to the Court to ask for expungment.
From Probation Agent Stephanie Engel re: progress report update on DE. hml
Probation review hearing on September 26, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

Probation review hearing on September 12, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

Court Orders DEF to provide copy of written assessment within 30 days. Court instructs DEF to complete community service and provide verification that community service is complete at next hearing. CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Rohan, ADA: not present, Jonathon A. Brugler pro se. Case called at 10:39 am. Court reviews file. Court questions DEF. DEF states he is complying with terms of probation. Court will review file in 45 days. Address confirmed. Adjourned 10:42 am
Probation review hearing on April 14, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Probation review hearing on March 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot, NONA by def. Agent Engel appeared. Set for PRH. Case called at 10:35 am. Court reviews file. Agent Engel requests warrant. Def appears at 10:36 am. Court questions. Def responds. Agent Engel makes statement. Court signs extension of probation for 1 year. Address confirmed. Court quashes warrant. km  Probation review hearing scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Agent Engel. Re: attached progress report. km
Probation review hearing on February 10, 2017 at 10:30 am.
verbal DPA - Count 1. eif

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Jonathon A. Brugler appeared. Includes 15CM444, 15CM520 and 15FO263. Case called at 3:17 pm. ADA Correll recites agreement. No objection from Atty Caton.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to 15CM520. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #1 on 15CM520.  Counts two and three in 15CM444 are read in for sentencing purposes and dismissed. Court holds Count #1 in 15CM444 open for a year to make Def is compliant. Court dismisses 15FO263. Parties make sentencing arguments. Court orders: 1 year probation w/h with conditions - 
- 60 Days Jail STAYED
- Restitution to be deteremined within 60 Days
- Court Costs - $243.00
- DNA Surcharge $200.00; Apply Bond
- 25 Hours of Community Service
- AODA within 45 Days
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation within 45 days if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- No Contact with Freedom Gas Station or K. Monroe
- Apology Letter within 30 Days
- Restorative Justice if requested
- Sign up for probation by 4:00 pm on Feb. 17th, 2016
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Defendant is eligible for expungement if probation is completed successful
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-17-2016 02:15 pm

Court reviews files. Atty Caton makes statement. There is an agreement. Address confirmed. Bond continues. km  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Jonathon A. Brugler appeared. Includes 15CM444, 15CM520 and 15FO263. Case called at 11:09 am. Filed by ADA Correll. km
Defendant's. Filed by Atty Caton.
to Mary Guzlik ck# 025036 sent this date. eif
Atty. J. Caton. gme
Status conference at 10-29-2015 10:30 am

Bond on file

INCLUDES 15CM444 & 15CM520

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kay M. or the Freedom Gas Station in Hudson WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: TCH for EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Jonathon A. Brugler appeared.   Includes 15CM520, 15CM444 & 15FO263.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all cases/charges.  Waives speedy trial. Refund $500.00 to payor.  Status conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Mary Guzik  15R 010278. eif
